summary: This document is a chain of internal FBI emails from August 2023 discussing a victim's claim of submitting a report about Jeffrey Epstein to the FBI in 1996. The emails involve FBI personnel in New York and Washington, D.C., coordinating to locate the historical report (an FD-71) and preserve related case files from Miami and New York investigations.

persons.name: Special Agent - FBI New York Field Office
persons.context: An FBI Special Agent from the New York Field Office's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit who provides information about the FD-71 report from the early 2000s investigation and mentions contacting Miami agents.

persons.name: Assistant General Counsel Litigation Branch I OGC
persons.context: An FBI Assistant General Counsel in Washington, D.C., who is inquiring about a 1996 victim report, coordinating the preservation of case files, and managing litigation holds related to Epstein claims.

connections.person1: Special Agent - FBI New York Field Office
connections.person2: Assistant General Counsel Litigation Branch I OGC
connections.description: They are FBI colleagues communicating via email to investigate a historical victim claim and preserve evidence related to Epstein investigations.

events.title: Alleged 1996 Victim Report to FBI
events.description: An alleged victim of Jeffrey Epstein claims she submitted a report to the FBI in 1996.

events.title: Receipt of New SF95 Claim
events.description: The FBI Office of the General Counsel receives another SF95 (administrative claim) from a victim alleging negligence related to the Epstein investigations.
personsInvolved: Assistant General Counsel Litigation Branch I OGC

events.title: Internal FBI Email Chain on 1996 Report
events.description: FBI personnel in New York and Washington, D.C., exchange emails to locate a 1996 victim report (FD-71) and discuss the preservation of related case files.
personsInvolved: Special Agent - FBI New York Field Office
Assistant General Counsel Litigation Branch I OGC

keyFacts: An alleged victim of Jeffrey Epstein claims to have submitted a report to the FBI in 1996, which the FBI was attempting to locate in 2023.
The only document found related to this early claim was an FD-71 (FBI form for documenting information) from the early 2000s Miami investigation.
The FBI was actively preserving physical files from the Epstein/Maxwell investigations (case numbers 31E-MM-108062 and 50D-NY-3027571) due to ongoing litigation and new administrative claims (SF95s).
The Miami case file (31E-MM-108062) was transferred to New York around 2019.
The correspondence shows internal FBI coordination between the New York Field Office and the Office of the General Counsel in Washington regarding historical Epstein case materials.
